Posts.Content: Thank you George and Jackie, I was just about to throw out all my yoghurts and milk- I had already picked up that Soya is not good so was wondering what I should put on my porridge! Lynne
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hi Fran,  I have only just started my Letrazone 3 weeks in- achy joints but not dreadful. I have been taking codliver oil and calcium tablets. I have had my flu jab to be on the safe side. I will also be intersted in those who have been on long term Lynne
Posts.Title: Letrozole tablets and side affects

Posts.Content: I was told by a pharmicist that you can get gauntlets and sleeves for the arm to help reduce the build up of fluid- is this treatment common? I am going next week to get lymphs removed in one arm. Can anyone tell me? Lynne
Posts.Title: swollen arm

Posts.Content: Thanks so much Judith, that was so helpful I will talk to my bcn when I go in next week. Thanks again Best of luck and I hope yours clears up quickly Lynne
Posts.Title: swollen arm

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, I have been down the same track as you. I had my results last week after masx, reconst and then full node clearnce... I was told that I had 3 nodes infected out of 14. The oncologist at Addenbrookes was great and gave me so much information, he said that in America they do not go onto chemo or radio unless 4 nodes are cancerous. So I was given the choice. He also told me that , have asked for the full path results, the M1 that I showed indicated that my cancerous cells do not double very fast- very indolent( his phrase). I decided not to have chemo and go straight onto tablets. He then told me I will need to take Letrozole for 2 years and then tomoxifen for 8 years. His view was that it reduces the side effects by changing half way. I am no expert and am working my way through the path report to understand it- but I am glad I have it.. I know exactly how you feel I said the same thing when I went in. GOOD LUCK- Iwill be thinking of you Lynne
Posts.Title: Results day -what questions to ask?

Posts.Content: I am so pleased for you- I am still waiting for a date next week as the cancer surgeon cannot get an agreed date with the plastics. I have a very good V shaped pillow at home that my husband used when he was just out of hospital. It is very useful to prop yourself up and to use during the night. Good luck, will think of you tomorrow M Lynne
Posts.Title: Mastectomy -1day to go

Posts.Content: I take mine in the evening,, I only get the normal side effects, some achy joints but they have been better since I took Cod liver oil and calcium supplements. Good luck
Posts.Title: Letrezole

Posts.Content: Hi, I am just trying to make the decision as to whether to have a delayed reconstruction. I have heard that without one there is back and neck pain. I have been told that I will not need radiotherapy, and some of you seem to have problems when that was necessary. Not sure about chemo because lymph has not been cleared yet
Posts.Title: Immediate versus delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: Thanks alot misty - that is really helpful. It is making my mind up.  M Lynne
Posts.Title: Immediate versus delayed reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi George I have just started to take Letrazole- what do you mean Jackie aged 25 years? I am worried now Lynne

Posts.Title: Exemestane

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey, Totally agree, I found my lump when examining my breasts after a clear mammogram last year, it had obviously been growing slowing(2) for some time.  But I would also put a warning on ultrasound. My first ultrasound I was told that it was probably an infection and given a week on antibiotics. Luckily when I returned another one of the team did another ultrasound  and then a deep biopsy, and found the cancer. I think it depends on the person doing the ultrasound. Thankfully since then I have had brilliant care. By the way those surgeons have a funny way of expressing things. When I was first told I needed a lumpectomy( since changed to msx) he likened it to an apple corer- as it is on the nipple- only a man could do that, ouch! M Lynne
Posts.Title: An uneasy question to ask about a previous mammogram

Posts.Content: How did you find having immediate reconstruction-how long does it take to recover? Thats what I am thinking of having but am a bit confused by the different types. How long were you in hospital? Lovely to hear how positive everyone is- gives me hope .Thanks MLynne
Posts.Title: Expander Implant advice please

Posts.Content: I had  mastectomy with latissimo dorsi reconstruction on 26th August. I found it difficult in the first couple of days to put on  bras without hooks.  found it easier to hook round the front and then turn it round. However after I got home I was finding a big problem with  night time- I would turn in my sleep and my breast would follow!! because it was a bit swollen- I would wake up suddenly. However I got some stretchy ones from Sainsbury's would you believe- only tried that because the friend who was driving me around wanted to go there- they have been excellent and have given me great help at night.  I was also fine going home with a bra on. Putting on PJ bottoms were not a problem at all - and the hospital ( Addenbrookes) had a lovely array of pretty bags to put my drains in- so that was good. Apparently they are made by a friend of one of the nurses. Good luck- hope everything goes as well as mine seems to have done. Only downer is that I have to go back for lymph removal next week which I am not looking forward to. MLynne
Posts.Title: trying to prepare for mastectomy
